title: What is the primal mentality and its relationship with magic and power?
first_phrase: In the previous text, we explored the concept of mana or imanu, which is the essential and mystical reality believed to circulate beneath different forms in primitive mentality. This reality is perceived immediately and precedes any other experience. In this final part (NIP, AP), we delve deeper into the primitive mindset and how it views beings and objects as homogeneous. We also see how the magical worldview of power ties into the quantity of mana an object or being possesses, making it more real. Overall, this section provides a comprehensive understanding of the vital concepts to primitive thought and how it affects their perception of the world.

last_phrase: In summary, for primitive cultures, everything is seen as a manifestation of mystical force or mana, and the more mana something has, the more real it is. There is no separation between the visible and invisible realms, and all beings and objects are considered homogenous. It's crucial to consider these different perspectives when trying to comprehend the worldviews of others.
